results.title: ‘In the Heights’ Review: In Dreams Begin Responsibilities
results.abstract: Lin-Manuel Miranda’s musical comes to the screen as an exuberant and heartfelt party, directed by Jon M. Chu and starring Anthony Ramos.

results.title: They Fought to Make ‘In the Heights’ Both Dreamlike and Authentic
results.abstract: The creative team of Lin-Manuel Miranda, Quiara Alegría Hudes and Jon M. Chu explain what it took to create a euphoric spectacle that stayed true to its cultural roots.

results.title: A Film Tries to Make a Difference for Domestic Violence Survivors
results.abstract: “And So I Stayed” examines how the courts treat women who kill their abusers. The movie played a role in one case that resulted in freedom after a conviction.

results.title: Ned Beatty, Actor Known for ‘Network’ and ‘Deliverance,’ Dies at 83
results.abstract: In a career that spanned more than four decades and more than 150 movie and TV roles, Mr. Beatty was rarely the star but almost always made a strong impression.

multimedia.caption: Ned Beatty in 2003. He was rarely cast in leading roles, but he was associated with some of Hollywood’s most enduring films.
Ned Beatty in 2003. He was rarely cast in leading roles, but he was associated with some of Hollywood’s most enduring films.

results.title: Milton Moses Ginsberg, 85, Unconventional Filmmaker, Dies
results.abstract: His movies about a psychiatrist’s disintegration and a werewolf in the White House originally bombed, but they both drew favorable attention many years later.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “The Werewolf of Washington,” Milton Moses Ginsberg’s 1973 political parody, which starred Dean Stockwell as a White House official who turns into a werewolf.

results.title: Baron Davis Directs Now. If There’s a ‘Space Jam 3,’ He Wants In.
results.abstract: The former N.B.A. star’s first movie, “Domino: Battle of the Bones,” is as in-your-face as his playing style. And he’s got plenty more big-screen ideas.

multimedia.caption: In addition to studying books on directing, Davis spent time with Spike Lee and other filmmakers while making commercials, and came away thinking, “Yo, you know what? I can do this.”

results.title: The Enduring Appeal of Italian Composers’ Dramatic ‘Library Music’
results.abstract: Compositions made from the 1960s through the ’80s to soundtrack films and ads have found new homes on hip-hop tracks and compilations. New artists have been inspired, too.

multimedia.caption: The record collector Lorenzo Fabrizi, who runs the label Sonor Music Editions, discovered a warehouse of albums containing library music in 2011.

results.title: The Tribeca Festival Is Back, Happy to Restart Along With the City
results.abstract: The annual event, which has dropped “film” from its name, began after 9/11, as part of New York City’s comeback. Can it stage an encore this month?

multimedia.caption: Jane Rosenthal, left, and Paula Weinstein at the 2013 edition of the festival. As they were planning this year’s event, the lockdown situation was still unclear.

results.title: MoviePass Deceived Users So They’d Use It Less, F.T.C. Says
results.abstract: Federal regulators detailed tactics the company, which settled accusations against it, used to try to make its most active users go to the movies less.

multimedia.caption: MoviePass, though it quickly amassed more than three million subscribers, was never popular with major theaters, which called the service unsustainable.
MoviePass, though it quickly amassed more than three million subscribers, was never popular with major theaters, which called the service unsustainable.

results.title: Everyone Has a Theory About Shopping Carts
results.abstract: An essential tool. An inspiration for artists. A public nuisance. The humble shopping cart has been all of these in the decades since it was invented. But what does it reveal about our character?
